utterance.speaker: TOM RICHWOOD
utterance.content: You know, after six months Mars is starting to remind me of Kauai. Except without the water, or the hot girls in bikinis, or the air. What I wouldn’t give for a hot girl. And after all this time, I’d even take an ugly one. Assuming she came with a paper bag.

utterance.speaker: ELISE KIM
utterance.content: Oh, real classy, Richwood. Just repair the short. And make sure the 4B coil isn’t fried. We can’t afford to have the power grid compromised.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Aye aye, Captain.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Oh boy. Bad news. It’s charred. I may have to replace the power coupling and reboot the …

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Can you repeat that, Richwood? Interference. Come again?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Watch out!

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Tom? Tom?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Tom!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t wait to take off my ­– – shoes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: So much for a quiet evening at home.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I thought you guys were working late tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Slow murder day. We got off early. You’re playing laser tag? Without me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that my gear?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, Dad, Beckett, this is David. He bet me I couldn’t beat him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She trounced you, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: DAVID
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh my! What is going on down here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Far too much, apparently. Are those my pajamas?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. Oh, oh, oh, oh. I’m so sorry, Ben. Um … family, Benjamin. Ben, meet my family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we got a murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, to solve. Not commit.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those were my softest pajamas and now I’m going to have to burn them. Is it just me or is the loft getting awfully small these days?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, four adults in one space? We’re bound to step on each other’s toes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, there’s a lot more toes than usual tonight.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys. Glad you’re here. You’re going to want to see this. Especially you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s mission control. And that’s Mars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And there’s your body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our victim is on Mars? The secret manned mission to Mars rumors were true. I knew it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, this might be a little out of our jurisdiction.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s not Mars. This is operations director Ed Redley. This is Detectives Beckett and Ryan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: ED REDLEY
utterance.content: What you’re seeing is a live feed from a simulation we’re conducting in advance of a real Mars mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s we? NASA?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: It’s the Mars 2018 Project. We’re privately funded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. By Viggo Jansen, the internet billionaire. He promised to put humans on Mars by 2018. Held a competition and everything. I signed up for the program, but I didn’t get in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you signed up to go to Mars? When?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A couple years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where was I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were fighting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The victim, pilot Tom Ridgewood, was supposedly alone on the uh … planet’s surface conducting repairs.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: We were in a communication blackout, part of simulating planetary conditions, when the mission commander broke protocol to tell us they found Tom dead. They don’t think it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’d like to see the body, so where’s the simulation?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: A couple of floors below us, and that’s easier said than done.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In order to mimic conditions on Mars, as well as discourage any cheating, the simulation is filled with noxious gas.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: It won’t kill you, but it will induce severe nausea and a rash. It would take several days to vent the sim to make the air breathable, so if you want to go in you’re going to need to wear spacesuits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best case ever!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This way?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What can you tell us about the victim?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: Tom Richwood was a mission pilot, a former Navy Top Gun, did a tour with NASA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about a family?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: None, which made him a perfect candidate for the mission. He beat out some of the smartest, most competitive candidates in the world to be part of the first manned team to Mars. They all did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who else is inside?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: Our four remaining astronauts. The team’s medical specialist, Dr. Haroum, is waiting for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So has anyone been in or out of the simulation recently?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: No. It’s a sealed nine month experiment. No one’s been in or out since the astronauts entered six months ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which means one of them probably did it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only three suits.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um … that’s okay. We don’t all need to go in. I’ll go take statements back at the facility.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You don’t want to go to Mars?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A, it’s actually not Mars. And B, I’m happy here on Earth. But have fun, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me, I will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Finally made it Mars. Didn’t even have to go to astronaut training.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you really signed up to go to Mars, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t that be cool? Well, not so much for you, but for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And nobody saw this happen?

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: No, we were all in the module. We heard him scream. He must have fallen into the coupling coil, because right then the power went out. By the time Angela and I got out here, he was gone. It took us another ten minutes to get the power restored.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It looks like a stab wound.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Delivered with a lot of force.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, where’s the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: There wasn’t one. But one of his tools, his screwdriver, is missing. It looks like this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s pretty rocky around here. No footprints.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And because the killer was probably wearing a suit there’s not going to be any DNA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s get his body to the morgue and find out. And get CSU down here. I want this place searched. If no one’s been in or out then that murder weapon is still inside here. Dr. Haroum, I’d like to speak to the other astronauts, please.

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: They’re inside. Follow me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One small murder for man, one giant mystery for mankind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even when you whisper, everyone can hear you.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: You know the rest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where were each one of you when this happened?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Angela, Rusham, and I were here, in the command module. Mikhail was over in engineering.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And is there access to the outside from engineering?

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: There is emergency hatch, but if I had gone through it the alarm would have sounded.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Plus, as part of the program we’re all closely monitored, in case we lose consciousness or there’s a suit malfunction on an EVA. We all have trackers under our skin.

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: And MIRA keeps a record of all our movements.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s MIRA?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: That’s what we call the mission computer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I would like to take a look at those records.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: I would be happy to provide you with any records you require, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It talks?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Yeah. We think of her as the sixth member of the crew.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t that a little 2001?

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: She is programmed to learn and adapt, but she’s more Siri than HAL. Ask her where you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: MIRA, where are we?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: You are aboard the vessel Tenzing Norgay in the northern lowlands of Mars.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: She actually thinks she’s on Mars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Regardless, I’m going to have to ask all of you to join me at the precinct so I can interview you properly.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: That … could be a problem.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. I can’t let you remove the astronauts. I don’t have that kind of authority.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, who does?

utterance.speaker: VIGGO JANSEN
utterance.content: That would be me. And my astronauts aren’t going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Viggo Jansen. The Viggo Jansen.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Detective, if we shut down now we will lose months of priceless data. Millions of dollars of experiments will be compromised. We’ll lose half a year and we don’t have that time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Jansen, it’s not a request. A man has been murdered and I need to conduct an investigation.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: And I will do everything in my power to help you. Short of shutting down my sim.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Mars is our generation’s space race. And my team’s going to be first. Not the Chinese, or Mars 1, or that puffed up movie producer, Sir Ian Rasher.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I could get a court order to compel you.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: And with my legal team it’ll take you months. Or, we work together. I give you all the access you need and my simulation keeps running.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Fine. For now. But if I find out any of those people are responsible you won’t stop me from removing them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, according to this tracking data none of them seem responsible. They were all exactly where they said they were at Tom’s approximate time of death. It even confirms that the mission’s rover was still parked at the habitat at the time of the incident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There goes my rise of the machines theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so if all the people inside are accounted for, then our killer must have come from outside the simulation.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: We would know. The airlock door is the only way in or out. It’s alarmed and monitored.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. Detective Beckett, there’s a message coming in for you from the habitat. I can put it on the monitor if you like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo. What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was just going through our victim’s video diary. There’s something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Six months in and I know part of this mission’s a psych experiment. Maybe the close quarters are starting to get to me, but I think I’m starting to see things. When I was out there today I could have sworn I saw someone. And it’s not the first time. I know it’s not possible, but I don’t think we’re alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hang tight. I may have some more questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go ahead, Espo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So I just finished talking to the other astronauts. None of them seem to have any idea what Tom’s talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Thanks, Espo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU just finished their initial sweep. There’s no one else in that simulation.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: It’s possible Tom was seeing things. All our tests show that being locked in a confined space with others can play tricks on your mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only delusions don’t kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if what Tom said was true then whoever killed him might have been able to get in and out undetected.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: I told you, Detective. Given our security that’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: Sir? Maybe not.

utterance.speaker: MISSION CONTROL TECH
utterance.content: At Detective Ryan’s request I ran a check on all our security systems. Everything looked normal until I got into the deep code.

utterance.speaker: MISSION CONTROL TECH
utterance.content: See that?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Our security system’s been hacked. Key cards, alarm codes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning someone could have broken into the simulation.

utterance.speaker: MISSION CONTROL TECH
utterance.content: Based on our backup files these changes were made two days ago. Sometime between 11:10 and 11:14 at night.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Digital tracing indicates we were breached from the outside. Someone broke through our firewall.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell who?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: We log every IP address that connects to the mainframe. I’m running a trace now for that time window.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: There. Third one down. I don’t recognize that one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. We should be able to trace it.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Don’t bother. I just did. It’s coming from a residential WiFi registered to a – you’ve gotta be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Clint Granger. Hot-head pilot. He was one of our applicants until he was kicked out of the program.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’d he get kicked out?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: He accused Tom of sabotaging him during candidate testing. Claimed it lost him the pilot’s spot.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: So he tried to run Tom over in the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was this?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: Seven months ago. But he did say he’d be back to finish the job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you tried to run him over with your car?

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: It should have been me on that mission, not him. He stole my spot in history. And you ask me? He got what he deserved. But I did not kill him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And yet we traced that cyber-attack to your apartment.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: I am a pilot, not a computer geek. I couldn’t rewrite that code if the mission depended on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could have hired someone.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Yeah, but I didn’t. Look, when Tom was getting himself murdered I was at dinner with a friend in Connecticut. And when that hack took place from my WiFi I wasn’t even in the country. Someone’s setting me up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Granger’s alibi checks out. He was at dinner with a friend when Tom Richwood was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the night the hack took place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Granger was visiting his brother in Nova Scotia. It wasn’t him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mars? Nova Scotia? This guy really loves barren landscapes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, Ryan, you’re telling me you have no desire to go to Mars?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I prefer my oxygen without a can.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s your sense of adventure? Of exploration? Of – destiny?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If I want to fly thousands of miles to see a lifeless orb I could just visit Jenny’s grandmother. Same hostile environment, same freezing temperatures, same noxious atmosphere. Huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh? Huh, what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is a video of Granger’s apartment lobby the night of the hack. Check it out. This guy enters the building at 11:05PM, just before the hack too place. Now watch. Fifteen minutes later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He leaves the building. He could have piggybacked on Granger’s wireless and used that to carry out the attack on the simulation security.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but who is he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His name is George Reyes. The folks down at Mars 2018 recognized him immediately. He’s a senior facilities engineer and called in sick yesterday. Nobody’s been able to reach him since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have a motive to break into the simulation and kill Tom?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not that anyone knew. But his colleagues say that he’s been acting secretive the last couple of days. Ever since receiving a private communicad from his wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does his wife got to do with this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe everything. Ask me who his wife is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s his wife?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Angela Olvera. One of the other astronauts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was on the message?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: I was letting George know that I wanted out of our marriage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You broke up with him from space?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: He was sending me all these sweet emails. I couldn’t let it go on. I had to tell him that I’d fallen for someone else. Someone on the mission.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was it Tom?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: No, not Tom.

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Angela?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: I didn’t say who it was in my letter. Maybe he thought it was Tom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have reason to?

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: Yeah, he did. Tom wouldn’t stop hitting on me all throughout training. George told him if he didn’t stop he’d make him pay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I found him. He’s at the airport. Just bought a ticket to San Francisco. Airport security just picked him up.

utterance.speaker: GEORGE REYES
utterance.content: We were a team. Angela and me. We were going to go to Mars together or not at all. But when she got in and I didn’t, I couldn’t stand in her way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hard enough to have her leave the planet, but to leave you for someone else? You must have been devastated.

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: Try utterly destroyed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you hacked security? In order to break into the simulation and kill the man that you thought was Angela’s lover?

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I had nothing to do with Tom’s death. I was going to sabotage the mission. I figured if the mission suffered a catastrophic failure it would set the program back and Angela would come home to me. But I chickened out. The hack, setting it up to lead back to Granger, that’s as far as I got. I never went inside and I sure as hell didn’t kill anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why were you leaving town?

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: She dumped me. How I was I supposed to keep going to work there? I needed a fresh start. Ever since I got her letter I’ve spent nights drowning my sorrows at O’Malley’s. That’s where I was when Tom was murdered. You can ask them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay then. So whoever could have used your hack to get through the airlock?

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: It was calibrated to my biometrics. No one else could have used it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But someone did.

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: No. If they got in they did it some other way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is no other way.

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: I’m not so sure about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: GEORGE
utterance.content: I studied the facility plans. The simulation is like a bank vault. To get in you’ve got to get past guards, security systems, cameras. But like a bank vault, if you’re motivated enough there’s always another way in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really think someone could have tunneled their way into the sim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but since George’s alibi checked out we’re going to have to look at all of our options. Including the unlikely ones. According to George’s map, this abandoned utility access runs directly under Jansen’s facility.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but who would hate Tom enough to tunnel through five feet of concrete to kill him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but uh … … but it looks like someone did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, boost me up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why am I always on the bottom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, dear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Planets, dank access ways. Is it just me or does this remind you of Alien?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know that you want this to be science fiction, but we are not in space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but wouldn’t you like to be? Come on. You’re a sci-fi geek. Wouldn’t you just love to go to Mars?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course I would, that’s why I applied to Ian Rasher’s program last year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, what? You applied to go to Mars? Without me? When?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we were fighting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Well, I deserve that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh geez. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone did tunnel up. Castle? I think I found the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hear what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something’s down here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Some thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Told you this felt like Alien.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop! This is not Alien.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did that look human to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. See, I’m betting it's a xenomorph stranded here on Earth, attracted to the simulation because it needs the toxic environment. Probably saw Tom as encroaching on its territory and killed him for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Checking you for bites and scratches. Making sure you didn’t somehow get impregnated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you think that’s how I get pregnant we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It shed its skin!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not skin. It’s a gas mask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a breathing hose. For a human.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To protect themselves from the fumes of the simulation. Someone was trying to break in.

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: Yes, this was the access point.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Why would someone tunnel into my simulation?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe it’s one of your competitors. Maybe it’s espionage. Or sabotage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And our victim might have found out and threatened to expose them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either way, this explains what he saw. Why he thought there was someone else in there with him.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: How did they elude my cameras?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe they were working with someone who was involved in your program and knew when the cameras would be blacked out. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So CSU just confirmed it. The blood on the screwdriver belonged to Tom. It’s our murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, any prints?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but if the killer was in the simulation –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then they would have been wearing gloves. Um, okay, what about the gas mask? Anything from that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks military, but we’re still trying to run it down. Meantime, Ryan’s pulling camera footage from the surrounding area. Maybe we’ll get lucky, catch our alien exiting one of the access points to the utility tunnel. Probably won’t know anything until morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Keep me apprised.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you think about anyone who would have wanted to breach your simulation and we’ll keep you posted on what we find.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God. What a day. I feel like I’m still covered in spider webs. I cannot wait to take a hot shower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Maybe I could, uh … join you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that would be nice. We could relax, have a glass of wine, and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s your mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Ben. And Alexis is here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With friends.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we could go to a hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet you think you could survive being stuck in a space capsule with four other people for a year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could if you were one of those people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wow, you guys.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Get a room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We would if there were any left!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you shouldn’t have been so quick to sublet your place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe we could set up a schedule. Or they could give us a heads up and let us know what to expect when we get home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to call a family meeting. Or we could just go to Mars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think you’d be happy there. There’s no showers, there’s instant coffee, and you have to bag your own –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Castles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Any luck on that security cam footage?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nada. Your alien must have accessed the underground where there wasn’t any coverage. But we did have better luck with that gas mask. CSU was able to pull exhaled breath condensate from the inside of the faceplate. They contain trace amounts of DNA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get a match in the system?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not our system, but as part of the Mars 2018 program every applicant had to submit sample DNA. So we ran it against that database and guess who popped up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! Granger’s our alien?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was getting in and out. Just not the way we thought.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means his alibi was a lie. As soon as he knew we were on to him –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He went back to destroy the evidence. You bringing him in?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. Would if we could find him. But he’s not at his place and he’s not answering his phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, put out an APB. After our encounter in the dark he might be on the run.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I may know how to find him. That gas mask? It’s an uncommon make. Not a lot of suppliers in the city carry them. But I was able to track down the serial number to an Army/Navy supply store uptown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they confirm that Granger bought it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, the mask was purchased a couple of months back, so no one remembered the buyer. But it was charged to a corporate account. A company called Newton Endeavors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about them?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not much. Couldn’t find anything on the web, but I was able to track down an address out in Queens. Willis Point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Newton Endeavors. It sounds space related.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Space, the final frontier. These are the voyages of Castle and Beckett. Their ongoing mission: to explore strange new motives, to seek out new witnesses and new suspects for murder, to boldly go – oh, right over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, is this Newton Endeavors?

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: I’m sorry, this is private property. I’m going to have to ask you to leave.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. I’m going to have to ask you to open that door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it just me or does that capsule look incredibly familiar?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who would want to build a replica of Jansen’s Mars colony?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The competition. Granger must have been breaking into the sim to steal technology for Jansen’s competitors.

utterance.speaker: IAN RASHER
utterance.content: I don’t care if we have to pay them triple. We cannot fall any further behind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I think I know which one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep. Sir Ian Rasher, billionaire playboy adventurer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And possible accessory to murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You may want to rethink your application to his program.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: Good, good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Rasher? Detective Beckett, NYPD. I was wondering if we could have a word.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: Of course. What can I do for New York’s finest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you can start by telling me where Clint Granger is.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. I’m afraid I don’t know who that is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because looking around I’m guessing he’s the guy that you hired to steal Viggo Jansen’s plans for the Mars simulation.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: Detective, I employ the world’s best engineers. Why would I bother wasting my time on the competitor’s technology?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe because you’re falling behind them? It’s no secret your last two rocket launches were spectacular failures. You want to win so you needed to buy a competitive advantage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And after one of Jansen’s team members discovered what you were up to, a man with your reputation and knighthood, you had no choice but to have him killed.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: Killed? Who was killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One of Jansen’s astronauts, Tom Richwood.

utterance.speaker: RASHER
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the best way to convince me of that is to tell me where Granger is. Unless you prefer prison.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. I was spying for Sir Ian. He promised me the pilot’s slot in his mission if I did. But I was telling the truth about Tom. I didn’t kill him. I have an alibi, remember?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alibis can be bought. We found your DNA on the gas mask. We know it was you in the access way.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Because I didn’t want anything to do with this! I went to make sure I didn’t leave anything there that could point back to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like the murder weapon?

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Oh, come on. If I killed Tom do you really think I’d be stupid enough to leave the murder weapon there? Besides, I was never inside the simulation. That would have been way too risky. Too many opportunities to get caught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why the gas mask?

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: It was a precaution. I wasn’t using the tunnel to get in. It was drop point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were working with somebody in the inside.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: I needed access, he needed money. SO we struck a deal. He’d download schematics and plans and drop them for me in the tunnel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Mikhail Banhov.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The astronaut.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: If Tom was on to him then maybe he’s your killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked his tracker. He was inside the habitat at the time of the murder.

utterance.speaker: GRANGER
utterance.content: Mikhail knew if his movements were being recorded he’d never get away with what we were doing, so he beat the system. He cloned his tracker before they embedded it under his skin. As long as no one was looking he could slip out at any time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mikhail?

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’d like a few words with you?

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: What about?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your business relationship. With Clint Granger.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, Mikhail. Are you crazy? Bro! Where’re you going to run? You’re on Mars!

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: I hate to admit, but it’s good to be out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: What they say? Fresh air, Times Square?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well after the Mars simulation prison should be a breeze.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: So I was trading information. Big deal. I was leaving the planet and never coming back. I wanted to make sure my family was taken care of.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah. Noble.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: You Americans. Little corruption never hurt anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think Tom would agree.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: Tom? Tom was jackass. Drove everyone crazy, the way he doled out food and supplies and tried to leverage everyone for making even tiniest error. Trust me, they may be scared to say it, but no one’s sad he’s dead. No one was looking forward to spending rest of lives with him on other planet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet you are the only one who is unaccounted for during his murder. Which means you are the only one who could have killed him.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: Mmm… no. I could not. I can prove where I was during the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: When Commander Kim sent me down to engineering I used rare time alone to take pictures and download schematics from life support to give to Granger. I still have the drive with all of my photos. They are time stamped with the mission clock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So your alibi is that you were spying for Granger.

utterance.speaker: MIKHAIL
utterance.content: Go. Look at my photos. You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I went through all of Mikhail’s photos from the night Tom was murdered. As you can see, he’s telling the truth. See his reflection?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And the module clock confirms the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he faked the time. Or maybe it was Granger after all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It wasn’t Granger. Uh, Ryan, go back. To there. Now, zoom in on the window. Look down at the bottom right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that … the rover?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that the computer said that it was docked during the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clearly the computer was wrong. Now, uh … push in on the rover’s arm. Filter out some of that reflection

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the screwdriver.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s your killer holding the murder weapon. The rover did it.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: The rover was out? This can’t be right. All the data from MIRA indicates the rover was docked when Tom was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say the data’s wrong. According to your literature, that rover has the speed and dexterity to kill with mathematical precision.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Jansen, who has access to the rover controls? One of your astronauts? Someone mission control?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: No one has access. The rover is an extremely complex piece of equipment. Under human control there’s too high a margin for error. So we designed it to interface solely with the computer. Our astronauts describe the sort of task they want carried out and MIRA executes it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible someone could have asked her to kill Tom?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: MIRA wouldn’t comply with that sort of command. But something’s wrong. I need to talk to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Well is there somewhere we can do that privately? Without anyone hearing?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Yeah. The computer module pod inside the sim.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: I’ll let you know soon.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: In here.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: There. I’ve cut off communications with the rest of the habitat. No one can hear us.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Is that you Dr. Jansen?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Yes, MIRA.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: What are you doing on Mars, Doctor?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: I can to talk to you. You remember Detective Beckett and Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Of course. How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are we seriously about to interrogate a computer?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Detective, the word interrogate implies you believe I’m guilty of something. Of what do you think I am guilty?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least she’s not asking for a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … MIRA, we’d like to know where the rover was when Tom Richwood was killed.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: I already gave you that information, Detective. The rover was docked.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: MIRA, we know the rover wasn’t docked.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: We have photographs. Evidence.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Your evidence is incorrect. The rover was docked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: MIRA, prior to Tom’s death did someone instruct you to activate the rover?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: She’s drawing more power. Something’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: No. The rover wasn’t activated. The rover was docked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible someone could have doctored her memory?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: No one altered my memory, Mr. Castle. My memory is perfect.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Her memory core was designed to be a closed system. It can’t be altered. But something’s off. MIRA, run a level one diagnostic on all systems.

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: There is no need to run a diagnostic. All systems are optimal.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: How about we run it anyway?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: It violates my operational parameters.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: It’s a simple diagnostic. What parameter does it violate?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: It will compromise the mission.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: How will a diagnostic compromise the mission?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Answering that question will compromise the mission.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I do. She knows she’s lying to us and if she runs those diagnostics we’ll discover the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that truth will somehow put the mission at risk.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: She’s a machine. She can’t lie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said she’s programmed to learn. What if somebody taught her how? What if someone used her to kill and then to help cover up the crime?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: No, her core parameters can’t be altered. She programmed to protect the mission and everyone on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what if those operational parameters are in conflict with each other? What if someone she’s programed to protect is a threat to the mission? Um, MIRA, how would you classify Tom Richwood?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Sergeant Major Tom Richwood. Pilot. Systems engineering specialist. –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Right. Okay, um -

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: - Deceased.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was Tom a threat to the mission?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Why? Who told you Tom was a threat?

utterance.speaker: MIRA
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m not authorized to give you that information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because in her mind that information would be a threat to the mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s gotta be another way to find out.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: There is. I can reboot her. Everything she’s learned will be wiped but all recorded memory will stay intact. We’ll find out pretty quickly what happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Someone’s opened the vent to the outside. We’re taking in atmosphere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s MIRA! She’s trying to protect herself.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: No! MIRA, don’t shut me out!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that this is harmful but it wouldn’t kill us, right?

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Short term. Long term it’s deadly. We have to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s locked! Call for help!

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: Communications are dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: MIRA! Open the door. Open the pod bay door!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wanted to go to Mars, not die on Mars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. We’re not on Mars. We’re on Earth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello? Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you saying the computer tried to kill you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Just like in 2001. Kubrick was right. AI is a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: MIRA’s not AI yet. She can learn and adapt but she’s a machine. She cannot think for herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why’d she try to kill us?

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: It wasn’t MIRA. We just pulled apart the server. Someone imbedded a subroutine into the OS reset program.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The moment that you tried to reboot her that subroutine activated, trapping you guys inside.

utterance.speaker: ED
utterance.content: It also triggered a dump of MIRA’s memory circuits. All the mission data is gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this was a failsafe installed by whoever was behind this. We were never meant to find out about the rover or MIRA and on the off chance that we did the killer wanted to make sure we didn’t get any further.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By killing the only witness MIRA and her memory banks.

utterance.speaker: JANSEN
utterance.content: It has to be one of the astronauts. They’re the only ones who could have planted that subroutine, the only ones who could have convinced MIRA that Tom was a threat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but with the memory data unrecoverable it’s impossible to know which one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not impossible. As a matter of fact, there’s only on explanation that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: You can’t be serious. You think one of us is the killer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it was almost the perfect crime. All the mastermind needed was someone to pin it on and that’s where Mikhail came in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The killer must have found out that Mikhail was selling secrets, which made him the perfect patsy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All they had to do was make sure Mikhail was unaccounted for during Tom’s murder. That, and plant the weapon at his drop off point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Killing two birds with one stone. Tom, who everybody hated, and Mikhail, who was selling secrets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they sent Mikhail to engineering, where he would be blind to everything that happened. Only he didn’t stay there. Instead, he went to life support, where, with one photo, he exposed everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Commander Kim, it was you who sent Mikhail to engineering during the repair, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Yes. Though there’s nothing unusual about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But according to procedure isn’t Angela supposed to be there backing him up?

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: Yes, but I needed her up here checking protocols. That hardly makes me a murderer. And I hardly even left the module, so I – I couldn’t have planted the murder weapon in the tunnel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But Dr. Haroum and Angela could have done that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The two of you were outside, together, for ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: Yes, checking on Tom and restoring the power.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: While all the cameras were down, giving you enough time to ditch the murder weapon and clean any forensic evidence off the rover.

utterance.speaker: ANGELA
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. Are you just going to go after us one by one? I was with Rusham the whole time. He didn’t go anywhere near the rover.

utterance.speaker: HAROUM
utterance.content: And neither did Angela.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s what makes this crime so clever. From the beginning the three of you have been able to alibi each other out. Because you were all in on it together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It would have taken the three of you colluding to convince MIRA that Tom was threatening the mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And given the way you felt about Tom, you knew that the team couldn’t survive with him on it. He was a threat. Especially on a hostile planet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, after six months of being locked up in this tin can together, you decided that rather than sacrifice you chance at being the first human beings to stand on Mars, you would put your shot at immortality ahead of another man’s life.

utterance.speaker: KIM
utterance.content: That’s a fascinating theory. But with MIRA’s memory gone you have no proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, that’s what we thought as well. Until Dr. Jansen told us about MIRA’s black box.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the event of a catastrophic failure she pulses all her data to the nearest satellite. All your conversations with her, everything that you three did, it’s all there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the bad news is, none of you are going to Mars. Good news is the first one to cooperate will get the least amount of jail time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just didn’t expect them to cave that quickly. That was a clever ruse, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just glad it worked. And if there’s not a catastrophic black box satellite … there should be. What do you think is going to happen with Jansen?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he’s a pioneer. He’s a visionary. He may not get there in 2018, but I’m willing to bet he’s going to be the first. So, after all of this, you still want to go to Mars?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, of course. But I think I’m going to wait until they have first class service so we can go together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think at any point one of those astronauts turned to the others and said maybe killing Tom is a really bad idea?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that when people are stuck together in a small space for a long period of time they lose perspective. Speaking of which, um … wasn’t there supposed to be a family meeting tonight?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There is. I told Alexis she did not need to come because I wanted to talk to the two of you alone. Now, I know that things have been a little frenetic around here, what with Alexis and her friends and the two of you in and out at all sorts of odd hours, and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and your new boyfriend doing late night medleys.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, yes, well, there’s that. So I have decided, and I don’t want to upset either one of you, that I am going to look for a place of my own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To live?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, yes. I mean, not right away, of course. It’s going to take me awhile to find exactly the right space.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, I was just calling a family meeting. I didn’t intend for you to move out.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, this is not about you. This is about me. Think of it as kind of an evolution, you know? I’m – I’m starting to do very well for myself and I am guessing that um, before too long there’s going to be a few more little Castle’s creating havoc around here and I think the two of you deserve to have this place to yourselves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me know if there’s anything I can do?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. I will. Okay, I am off. I am spending the evening with Benjamin so don’t wait up. Bye!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I did not expect that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unexpected is her specialty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s so quiet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s really, really quiet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should go out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, there’s a great Indian restaurant that just opened up around the corner. Fantastic atmosphere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s loud. Super loud. A lot of people. Lots and lots of people.
